reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports not explicitly mentioned, but Panel of Experts to provide reports: midterm report by 3 August 2022 and 6 September 2022, final report by 3 February 2023 and 3 March 2023
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous relevant resolutions and statements, 
Decides to extend until 30 April 2023 the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in paragraph 29 of resolution 2094 (2013), with the mandate applying also to measures imposed in resolutions 2270 (2016), 2321 (2016), 2356 (2017), 2371 (2017), 2375 (2017), and 2397 (2017).

Requests the Panel to provide:
- A midterm report to the Committee by 3 August 2022, and to the Council by 6 September 2022.
- A final report to the Committee by 3 February 2023, and to the Council by 3 March 2023.

Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work within thirty days after reappointment and to provide updates.

Underscores the importance of credible, fact-based, independent assessments, analysis, and recommendations.

Expresses intent to review the mandate and take action by 25 March 2023.

Urges cooperation from States, UN bodies, and other parties with the Committee and Panel.

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
